data.name: Proofpoint
data.description: Proofpoint is a spam filter, block list, and firewall promoted for businesses, headquartered in California. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Proofpoint (*.ppe-hosted.com) before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such a allow lists and spam filtering policy levels. For globally-blocked IPs, the adminstrator of the IP will need to request delisting directly.

codes.description: The mail server encountered a temporary failure. If the command is repeated without any change, it might be completed. Mail servers can use temporary failures like this to keep untrusted senders at bay.

responses.response: smtp;421 4.1.1 <email@example.com>: Recipient address rejected: unverified address: host example.com[x.xx.xx.xx] said: 450 4.1.1 <email@example.com>: Recipient address rejected: unverified address: lost connection with mail.example.com[x.xx.xx.xx] while sending RCPT TO (in reply to RCPT TO command)
smtp;421 4.1.1 <email@example.com>: Recipient address rejected: unverified address: Address verification in progress

codes.description: The transaction failed permanently. The server will not try to send the message again.

The transaction failed permanently. The server will not try to send the message again. This is used as a general error code, so there are many reasons why you could be seeing it.

Itâ€™s common for email service providers to add a status code (5.1.1) after the SMTP reply code (smtp;550) for additional categorization of the issue.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.1.1 <email@example>: Recipient address rejected: User unknown
smtp;550 5.1.1 <email@example.com>: Recipient address rejected: undeliverable address: host example.com[x.xx.xx.xx] said: 550 5.1.1 <email@example.com>: Recipient address rejected: user unknown
responses.description: Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Proofpoint before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. If the message is rejected when Proofpoint attempts to finally deliver the message, they'll quote this rejection within the bounce response they send back to you. This is an example of that kind of relayed/quoted bounce.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.1.1 - This is not a valid email address. Please verify that you have the correct email address for your recipient.
smtp;550 5.1.8 <sender@example.com>: Sender address rejected: Domain not found (in reply to RCPT TO command)
responses.description: Make sure your 'From' and 'Return-Path' (envelope-from used for SPF) domains exist can receive mail.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.1.8 Domain of sender address does not exist
responses.description: Make sure your 'From' and 'Return-Path' (envelope-from used for SPF) domains exist can receive mail.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.5.2 <email@example.com>: Sender address rejected: need fully-qualified address (in reply to RCPT TO command)
responses.description: Make sure your 'From' and 'Return-Path' (envelope-from used for SPF) domains exist can receive mail.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.7.1 <email@example.com>: Recipient address rejected: User email address is marked as invalid.

responses.description: Recipient is not a Proofpoint customer or you are not allowed to use Proofpoint as an SMTP relay.
Recipient is not a Proofpoint customer or you are not allowed to use Proofpoint as an SMTP relay

responses.response: smtp;550 5.7.1 Service unavailable; client [x.xx.xx.xx] blocked using prs.proofpoint.com
responses.description: Your IP has been blocked by Proofpoint Dynamic Reputation and must be delisted to deliver mail.

responses.response: smtp;550 5.7.1 Service unavailable; client [x.xx.xx.xx] blocked using Cloudmark Sender Intelligence (Visit http://csi.cloudmark.com/reset-request/ if you feel this is in error)
responses.description: Your IP has been blocked by Cloudmark Sender Intelligence and must be delisted to deliver mail.

otherProviders.name: Mimecast
otherProviders.description: Mimecast is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution for promoted for businesses, headquartered in London. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Mimecast (*.mimecast.com) before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as spam policy levels and overrides (allow lists).

otherProviders.name: Trend Micro
otherProviders.description: Trend Micro is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution for promoted for businesses, headquartered in Tokyo. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Trend Micro (example: *.trendmicro.com). The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as spam policy levels and overrides (allow lists).

otherProviders.name: Barracuda
otherProviders.description: Barracuda is a spam filter, block list, and firewall promoted for businesses, headquartered in California. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Barracuda before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as allow lists, but sender reputation issues that affect all Barracuda customers globally may require contacting Barracuda support directly to resolve.

otherProviders.name: Email Security.cloud
otherProviders.description: "Email Security.cloud" is a product working in combination with "Symantec Messaging Gateway" as part of a range of services offered by Broadcom, headquartered in California. It features spam filtering, firewall protection, and block lists with resource guides of detailed troubleshooting steps for email delivery. Additionally, a legitimate email which has been incorrectly given a verdict of spam can be submitted to Symantec for analysis and filter review.

otherProviders.name: ZeroSpam
otherProviders.description: ZeroSpam is a spam filter, block list, and firewall promoted for businesses, headquartered in Quebec. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by ZeroSpam before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such as allow lists, but senders may also be able to contact a postmaster@zerospam.com and abuse@zerospam.com address to get more in-depth analysis.

otherProviders.name: Cisco
otherProviders.description: "Cisco Secure Email" is a spam filter, block list, and firewall solution promoted for businesses, headquartered in California. Mail is routed through mailservers owned by Cisco (imphmx.com) before it's passed along to the recipient domain's mailservers for final delivery. The recipient is able to manage a lot of delivery settings such a allow lists, so it helps to ask the recipient to run the described debugging tests in Cisco's User Guide to identify and resolve delivery issues.

otherProviders.name: Exchange Online
otherProviders.description: Exchange Online an email provider, headquartered in Washington as part of Microsoft. It's offered by both Office 365 and Microsoft 365, providing businesses with spam filtering, block lists, and firewall protection. If a message is going to spam or getting blocked, there are typically instructions for the email admin to fix the specific error in Exchange documentation.
